etymology.description: Phono-semantic: semantic 食 “food” + phonetic 反; simplified from 飯 (食 → 饣).
etymology.interpretation: Combines the food element 食/饣 with the sound-bearing 反 to signal pronunciation near fàn. The semantic component anchors meanings related to food, meals, and cooked rice.
etymology.simplification: The left component 食 was regularized to the shorthand radical 饣 to reduce strokes; the phonetic 反 remained unchanged.

examples.chinese: 我们一起吃饭吧(我們一起吃飯吧)。
中午我带饭去公司(中午我帶飯去公司)。
examples.pinyin: Zhōngwǔ wǒ dài fàn qù gōngsī.
examples.english: At noon I bring a meal to the office.

examples.chinese: 为了健康，他注意饮食，不吃油腻的饭菜(為了健康，他注意飲食，不吃油膩的飯菜)。
examples.pinyin: Wèile jiànkāng, tā zhùyì yǐnshí, bù chī yóunì de fàncài.
examples.english: For his health, he watches his diet and avoids greasy dishes.
